Okay, let me just emphasise this for everyone since nobody seems to actually have read it:

Yes, they're still developing it, it's just on hold while we wait for ZRM to go on his break from his college classes.

Just because he's not back yet doesn't mean it's dead forever... seriously. Sometimes people have things go on. Sometimes things come up, and they have better things to do than use their spare time to work on a mod.

Edited January 7, 2014 by NovaSilisko

Except for Bobcat's Buran. And Tiberion's Shuttle Booster System. And the Component Space Shuttle, if recent posts are to be believed. So it's actually only this mod that is dead-ish, and ZRM might just have been gobbled up by RL for the time - if we're lucky. He might also have lost interest in this project, but I wouldn't think so.

I'd amend that to "the fate of all mini shuttle projects". Buran, Tiberion's and CSS are full-sized.

Every small shuttle project I've seen so far remains unfinished today, curse or no curse.

*sigh* IT'S NOT DEAD. The authors are not actively posting new details, yes. That doesn't mean the project's dead. Give it 6 months before calling it, folks. Sometimes real life comes up and takes away your free time.

someone shoudl just lock this thread.. every time someone creates pointless reply i have my hopes that its developers informing on progress...

Yeah

Why does every mini shuttle mod have this happen to them.

Feature creep, that's why. I don't think it'll get released anytime soon. By the time it will be, it'll look bad by comparison with newer assets. Releasing in sections would've remedied this, but you've gotta have those shiny monitors or it won't fly...

Heck, I bet that if they dumped their own plugin and stuffed the cockpit with RasterProps it'll both be better and come out faster. BobCat's new HOME is already shaping up to have a better IVA than this.

I agree... It's not the first mod to never be released because it was getting overly ambitious. Most of us would have been happy with a first release without any IVA (I suspect that most of us never use IVA anyway).

I agree... It's not the first mod to never be released because it was getting overly ambitious. Most of us would have been happy with a first release without any IVA (I suspect that most of us never use IVA anyway).

So this is your way of telling the authors that they should just release their work, even though they don't think it's done? Calm down and give the authors some time, I'm sure they'll post some info when there's info to post. It's only one and a half month since author activity, you should give it at least 6 months before declaring it dead.

A pre-release, or a public beta, would go a long way towards making sure the mod isn't lost. Many mods did release incomplete versions. Sometimes they got polished later, sometimes they died afterwards, but as long as something is out there, a mod can be salvaged and the work finished by someone else.

So yeah. Even an incomplete release is better than no release at all.
